ratings.comment:
One of my favorite professors at UW. Canvas was perfectly organized, lecture topics were valuable and focused, and optional readings were always really well picked. The midterm and the assignments are pretty hard and you have to problem solve some things on your own, but you're supposed to.

Convinced me to do a career in UE, so honest 10/10
Very disorganized and rambles. Doesn't use any structure and not good at explaining things. Difficult to understand as well.

Gave no guidance on grade breakdowns. End of year grade stood at 94.94%, below the un-communicated cutoff of 95% for an A. No communication from her about grades and she ignored my emails. She seemed very nice, making this lack of communication very disappointing.

Attendance and participation are graded. One midterm and a big final group project. She was a nice caring professor but the class was disorganized in terms if her explanations and the final project criteria. Also her grading scale was wack a 85 was a BC. Overall easy manageable class.
Alina is a really nice professor. She is always accessible outside class even at midnight. Great passion on teaching and always encourages you to go further. Exam is really fair.

I really liked Professor Arefeva, but I hated the class. The grading scheme was obnoxious which makes me regret taking this class. Attendance is mandatory, and as much as Arefeva tried, the content wasn't that interesting. This class is also cross-listed with Econ, but Real Estate students had way more of an advantage than the Econ students.

Alina is a really intelligent person and has a lot of great research however her teaching skills are lacking. Not graded on much and the work isn't very hard either. You get a cheat sheet for the exams which is nice. Attendance was mandatory. Class is very boring.

She's alright. The class is crazy boring. It's cross-listed as an econ class but I would recommend not taking it if you don't have a background in RE because I was lost for much of the class. Only two power lectures per week, graded on participation in class, one midterm and a final, and a huge group project. It's overall easy but not fun at all.
